snippet: The people of Newtown buried two boys on Monday afternoon, in the first of the many funerals to follow last week’s massacre at the Sandy Hook Elementary School. The boys were both 6 years old.
abstract: People of Newtown, Conn, bury Noah Pozner and Jack Pinto, two six-year-old boys who were killed during massacre at Sandy Hook Elementary School; they are first of many funerals to come in grief-stricken community.

byline.contributor:
Reporting on the Connecticut
shootings was contributed
by Peter Applebome,
Peter Baker, Kitty
Bennett, Alison Leigh
Cowan, Stephen Farrell, Joseph
Goldstein, J. David
Goodman, Michael M.
Grynbaum, Amy Harmon,
Kristin Hussey, Ariel Kaminer,
Randy Leonard, Elizabeth
Maker, Michael Moss,
Jeremy W. Peters, William
K. Rashbaum, Ray Rivera,
Wendy Ruderman, Emily S.
Rueb, Derek Willis and Vivian
Yee.

lead_paragraph: The people of Newtown buried two boys on Monday afternoon, in the first of the many funerals to follow last week’s massacre at the Sandy Hook Elementary School. The boys were both 6 years old.

headline.seo: Two Funerals for Two 6-Year-Old Boys in Newtown
headline.main: With the Why Elusive, Two Boys, Two Burials
headline.print_headline: With the Why Elusive, Two Boys, Two Burials
